title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: "invalid enum variant tag while decoding `MacArgs`, expected 0..3"', compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/decoder.rs:243:57

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Notes Code itself is pertinent. If changed to ```let guess: u32 = 42;``` it compiles successfully. Code is from Rust Programming Language section 3.2, first paragraph. ### Code ```Rust fn main() { let guess: u32 = "42".parse().expect("Not a number!"); println!("The value of guess is: {}", guess); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.55.0 (c8dfcfe04 2021-09-06) binary: rustc commit-hash: c8dfcfe046a7680554bf4eb612bad840e7631c4b commit-date: 2021-09-06 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.55.0 LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` $ rustc -o test -g ./test.rs thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: "invalid enum variant tag while decoding `MacArgs`, expected 0..3"', compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/decoder.rs:243:57 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace ``` **Backtrace immediately following appears without RUST_BACKTRACE set, but backtrace in "Backtrace" section additionally appears, in this place, when RUST_BACKTRACE=full.** ``` error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.55.0 (c8dfcfe04 2021-09-06) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'already borrowed: BorrowMutError', /rustc/c8dfcfe046a7680554bf4eb612bad840e7631c4b/compiler/rustc_data_structures/src/sync.rs:423:16 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7fe245bc4b40 -
